intro: Duschekia ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed duschekia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, ovate leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are yellow with a central disc, and it blooms during the summer months. Duschekia ovata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
